what is git pull

git pull --helpë¡œ git pullì— ëŒ€í•œ ë„ì›€ë§ì„ ë³´ë©´

If the current branch is behind the remote, then by default it will fast-forward the current branch to match the remote. If the current branch and the remote have diverged, the user needs to specify how to reconcile the divergent branches with â€”rebase or â€”no-rebase (or the corresponding configuration option in pull.rebase).

hint: Pulling without specifying how to reconcile divergent branches is

hint:   git config pull.ff only       # fast-forward only
hint:
hint: You can replace "git config" with "git config --global" to set a default
hint: preference for all repositories. You can also pass --rebase, --no-rebase,
hint: or --ff-only on the command line to override the configured default per
